keyTakeAways: Ian Roberts, a former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, was indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form.
Roberts, originally from Guyana, is accused of being an illegal alien in possession of a firearm and making a false statement for employment.
He was detained by ICE on September 26, 2025, fled in a district-issued Jeep Cherokee, and was found with a handgun wrapped in a towel.
Three additional firearms were discovered during a search of his home, including two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun.
A federal immigration judge previously issued a final removal order, and an appeal to reopen proceedings was denied.
Roberts was transferred to federal custody on October 2, 2025, after being arrested.
The Des Moines Public Schools district is suing the consulting firm that facilitated the superintendent search, citing ethical and procedural concerns.
Jackie Norris, school board chair, proposed a review of Roberts’ expenditures and ended her U.S. Senate campaign following the AP investigation into the hiring process.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ian Roberts, the former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, was indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for illegally possessing firearms. Originally from Guyana, Roberts was detained by ICE on September 26, 2025, after fleeing in a district-issued vehicle, where authorities found a handgun wrapped in a towel. A subsequent search of his home revealed four weapons, including two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun. A prior immigration removal order had been finalized, and an appeal was denied. The Des Moines Public Schools district has filed a lawsuit against the consulting firm that facilitated the hiring process, citing unethical practices. School board chair Jackie Norris responded by proposing an audit of Roberts’ expenditures and ended her campaign for U.S. Senate, highlighting public distrust in the hiring process.
title: Iowa Superintendent Detained by ICE Falsely Claimed He Was a US Citizen, Indictment Says
